Key Arguments: Free speech should not be limited by the government.
Public debate is the best way to combat misinformation and disinformation.
The internet should remain a space free from government influence.
Government involvement in regulating speech could lead to authoritarianism.
Governments have historically spread misinformation themselves.
Censorship by Big Tech, influenced by governments, has biased information flow.
Freedom of speech is a fundamental human right that should not be compromised.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is an all-or-nothing concept; there are no gradations where it can be slightly limited.
The most effective way to combat misinformation or disinformation is through public debate.
If the government starts dictating what can or cannot be discussed online, both publicly and privately, our democratic society would transform into an authoritarian regime.
